verses.verse: Woe <S%H1945><s%> to the bloody <S%H1818><s%> city <S%H5892><s%>! it is all full <S%H4392><s%> of lies <S%H3585><s%> and rapine <S%H6563><s%>; the prey <S%H2964><s%> departeth not <S%H4185><s%>.

The noise <S%H6963><s%> of the whip <S%H7752><s%>, and the noise <S%H6963><s%> of the rattling <S%H7494><s%> of wheels <S%H212><s%>, and prancing <S%H1725><s%> horses <S%H5483><s%>, and bounding <S%H7540><s%> chariots <S%H4818><s%>,

the horseman <S%H6571><s%> mounting <S%H5927><s%>, and the flashing <S%H1300><s%> sword <S%H2719><s%>, and the glittering <S%H1300><s%> spear <S%H2595><s%>, and a multitude <S%H7230><s%> of slain <S%H2491><s%>, and a great <S%H3514><s%> heap of corpses <S%H6297><s%>, and there is no end <S%H7097><s%> of the bodies <S%H6297><s%>; they stumble <S%H3782><s%> upon their bodies <S%H1472><s%>;â€”

because of the multitude <S%H7230><s%> of the whoredoms <S%H2183><s%> of the well-favored <S%H2896><s%> harlot <S%H2181><s%>, the mistress <S%H1172><s%> of witchcrafts <S%H3785><s%>, that selleth <S%H4376><s%> nations <S%H1471><s%> through her whoredoms <S%H2183><s%>, and families <S%H4940><s%> through her witchcrafts <S%H3785><s%>.

Behold <S%H5002><s%>, I am against thee, saith Jehovah <S%H3068><s%> of hosts <S%H6635><s%>, and I will uncover <S%H1540><s%> thy skirts <S%H7757><s%> upon thy face <S%H6440><s%>; and I will show <S%H7200><s%> the nations <S%H1471><s%> thy nakedness <S%H4626><s%>, and the kingdoms <S%H4467><s%> thy shame <S%H7036><s%>.
And I will cast <S%H7993><s%> abominable filth <S%H8251><s%> upon thee <S%H5034><s%>, and make thee vile, and will set <S%H7760><s%> thee as a gazing-stock <S%H7210><s%>.

And it shall come to pass <S%H7200><s%>, that all they that look upon thee shall flee <S%H5074><s%> from thee <S%H559><s%>, and say, Nineveh <S%H5210><s%> is laid waste <S%H7703><s%>: who will bemoan <S%H5110><s%> her <S%H370><s%>? whence shall I seek <S%H1245><s%> comforters for thee <S%H5162><s%>?

Art thou better <S%H3190><s%> than No <S%H4996><s%> - amon <S%H527><s%>, that was situate <S%H3427><s%> among the rivers <S%H2975><s%>, that had the waters <S%H4325><s%> round about <S%H5439><s%> her <S%H2426><s%>; whose rampart was the sea <S%H3220><s%>, and her wall <S%H2346><s%> was of the sea <S%H3220><s%>?
Ethiopia <S%H3568><s%> and Egypt <S%H4714><s%> were her strength <S%H6109><s%>, and it was infinite <S%H369><s%>; Put <S%H6316><s%> and Lubim <S%H3864><s%> were thy helpers <S%H5833><s%>.

Yet was she carried away <S%H1473><s%>, she went <S%H1980><s%> into captivity <S%H7628><s%>; her young children <S%H5768><s%> also were dashed in pieces <S%H7376><s%> at the head <S%H7218><s%> of all the streets <S%H2351><s%>; and they cast <S%H3032><s%> lots <S%H1486><s%> for her honorable men <S%H3513><s%>, and all her great men <S%H1419><s%> were bound <S%H7576><s%> in chains <S%H2131><s%>.
Thou also shalt be drunken <S%H7937><s%>; thou shalt be hid <S%H5956><s%>; thou also shalt seek <S%H1245><s%> a stronghold <S%H4581><s%> because of the enemy <S%H341><s%>.

All thy fortresses <S%H4013><s%> shall be like fig-trees <S%H8384><s%> with the first-ripe <S%H1061><s%> figs: if they be shaken <S%H5128><s%>, they fall <S%H5307><s%> into the mouth <S%H6310><s%> of the eater <S%H398><s%>.

Behold <S%H5971><s%>, thy people in the midst <S%H7130><s%> of thee are women <S%H802><s%>; the gates <S%H8179><s%> of thy land <S%H776><s%> are set wide <S%H6605><s%> open <S%H6605><s%> unto thine enemies <S%H341><s%>: the fire <S%H784><s%> hath devoured <S%H398><s%> thy bars <S%H1280><s%>.

Draw <S%H7579><s%> thee water <S%H4325><s%> for the siege <S%H4692><s%>; strengthen <S%H2388><s%> thy fortresses <S%H4013><s%>; go <S%H935><s%> into the clay <S%H2916><s%>, and tread <S%H7429><s%> the mortar <S%H2563><s%>; make strong <S%H2388><s%> the brickkiln <S%H4404><s%>.

There shall the fire <S%H784><s%> devour <S%H398><s%> thee <S%H2719><s%>; the sword shall cut thee off <S%H3772><s%>; it shall devour <S%H398><s%> thee like the canker-worm <S%H3218><s%>: make thyself many <S%H3513><s%> as the canker-worm <S%H3218><s%>; make thyself many <S%H3513><s%> as the locust <S%H697><s%>.

Thou hast multiplied <S%H7235><s%> thy merchants <S%H7402><s%> above the stars <S%H3556><s%> of heaven <S%H8064><s%>: the canker-worm <S%H3218><s%> ravageth <S%H6584><s%>, and fleeth away <S%H5774><s%>.

Thy princes <S%H4502><s%> are as the locusts <S%H697><s%>, and thy marshals <S%H2951><s%> as the swarms of grasshoppers <S%H1462><s%>, which encamp <S%H2583><s%> in the hedges <S%H1448><s%> in the cold <S%H7135><s%> day <S%H3117><s%>, but when the sun <S%H8121><s%> ariseth <S%H2224><s%> they flee away <S%H5074><s%>, and their place <S%H4725><s%> is not known <S%H3045><s%> where they are <S%H335><s%>.

Thy shepherds <S%H7462><s%> slumber <S%H5123><s%>, O king <S%H4428><s%> of Assyria <S%H804><s%>; thy nobles <S%H117><s%> are at rest <S%H7931><s%>; thy people <S%H5971><s%> are scattered <S%H6335><s%> upon the mountains <S%H2022><s%>, and there is none to gather them <S%H6908><s%>.

There is no assuaging <S%H3545><s%> of thy hurt <S%H7667><s%>: thy wound <S%H4347><s%> is grievous <S%H2470><s%>: all that hear <S%H8085><s%> the report <S%H8088><s%> of thee clap <S%H8628><s%> their hands <S%H3709><s%> over thee <S%H7451><s%>; for upon whom hath not thy wickedness passed <S%H5674><s%> continually <S%H8548><s%>?
